physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 102/67 mm Hg, Heart rate: 60 bpm
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Dry mucous membranes. Normal findings from heart, lung, skin, and musculoskeletal examinations. Abdomen was soft, nontender, and nondistended.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial hyponatremia and acute kidney injury were resolved after fluid resuscitation, with hemoglobin and creatinine levels improving after treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Esophagogastroduodenoscopy revealed mild GERD without ulceration or H. pylori infection. Colonoscopy was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Diarrhea and abdominal pain reoccurred after initial improvement.
